title: How did I do that again?
content:
I’m designing my first font in illustrator which I will then take into Fontlab. The problem is I have given the font an ’inner outline’? and I now can’t figure out how I did it. It is all fill no stroke and is grouped into the top and bottom sections and their black outlines. The only things I remember doing are outline stroke, compound path and group ungroup. Here is the ’A’...Any illustrator gurus who can help?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201180540im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/A_4521.jpg)

 [‹ Belgian Typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201180540/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49451 "Go to previous forum topic") [Serif Font in Small Point Size ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201180540/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49510 "Go to next forum topic")
author: archetype_

comments.content:
not sure but...

it looks like you used a second stroke under appearance  
(a white one and a black one...)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201180540im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/s_5632.jpg)

or

you used offset path a couple of times...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201180540im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/ds_4249.jpg)

it looks like I’ve used stroke but when I go inside the group it has no stroke only fill...I specifically got rid of the stroke so I could take it over to Fontlab...Once I figure it out I’m definitely writing it down! And I don’t think I’ve used offset path before...thanks for the suggestions...
